comments:
Build: I-20040322

This one seems different from the one Olivier had fixed.

I was debugging my code and stepped into a parser class (coming from the JRE) 
that had no source attached.

I started getting a series of popups telling me that a Java AST creation error 
occurred.  Closing one will reopen a new popup dialog.

After a series of 15 or so, the dialogs stopped popping, and there were 
several instances of the following exception in the log (one per dialog).

FYI, I have the text editor feature "Mark occurrences" turned on.


!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 Mar 22, 2004 22:23:41.126
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Java AST creation".
!STACK 0
java.lang.IllegalStateException
	at org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.ASTParser.internalCreateAST
(ASTParser.java:612)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.ASTParser.createAST(ASTParser.java:563)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.ASTProvider.createAST
(ASTProvider.java:216)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.ASTProvider.getAST
(ASTProvider.java:178)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.viewsupport.SelectionListenerWithASTManager$PartLis
tenerGroup.calculateASTandInform(SelectionListenerWithASTManager.java:123)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.viewsupport.SelectionListenerWithASTManager$1.run
(SelectionListenerWithASTManager.java:101)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:62)

When no source is attached to a .class file, the DOM/AST tree creation should
not be done or it should catch the IllegalStateException.
This is documented as a potential exception in case no source is available.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 55589 ***
